missionProperties.missionInfo:
{-} Doors are locked. A Rebel figure can attack a door (Health: 9, Defense: 2 {G}).
{-} The mission will progress when a door opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

Maul and Zaaryn are holed up in a small Imperial communications center located on the edge of an urban park. The place is crawling with Imperial troops as Zaaryn’s contingent bolsters the center's standard compliment. You do not have the numbers to be able to cover both the front and rear entrances to the base, so you decide to attack from the front to prevent Maul or Zaaryn from reaching an escape vehicle.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Doors are locked. A Rebel figure can attack a door (Health: 9, Defense: 2 {G}).
{-} The mission will progress when a door opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

Maul snarls at you as you pin him down and aim your weapons at him. “Congratulations,” he says in a low rumble, "That trinket is your problem now." You search him and find a datapad with the coordinates on Coruscant where his agents stashed the sphere shard for him, Deciding he would be more trouble than he's worth to keep around, you release Maul and depart immediately for Coruscant to retrieve the artifact. {-} The Rebels win the mission! {-} The heroes receive the “Bardottan Shard” Reward card. (This Reward card works differently when playing with Imperial Commander. Refer to the Rules Change section of the wiki documentation for details.) {-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero. {-} Place Story Mission card “Capital Escape" into play.

“You are beaten," Maul shouts at you as his forces overtake you. He gives a signal and the Imperial officer Zaaryn emerges with a small squad. “Here’s my end of the  bargain, Zaaryn,” Maul says, gesturing to you and your team, “Now give my agents clearance to leave Coruscant.”

Zaaryn turns to Maul. “You may consider my end of the bargain... altered,” he says. His troops immediately turn on Maul, forcing him into an enraged retreat as Zaaryn’s team loads you onto a shuttle. "A Rebel strike force and the Bardottan shard; the Emperor might just make me the head of the ISB,’ Zaaryn says to himself before firing a stun blast, knocking you out.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} The threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) increases by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} Place Story Mission card “The Realm of the Dark Side” into play.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The door leads into the Imperial communications center.

{-} The door is locked. A Rebel figure can attack it (Health: 9, Defense: 2 {G}).

events.eventText: Beeps and whirs greet you as you enter the base and confront its mechanical guards and defense systems. You briefly catch a glimpse of Maul’s snarling face as he slips out the back door of the facility. You will have to catch up with him quickly!

eventActions.theText:
{-} The back door is locked. When there are no terminals on the map, that door opens.
{-} A hero can interact with a terminal to discard it. When he does, he may test {I} or {J} to try and claim that terminal instead.
{-} The mission will progress when the back door opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.tbText:
{-} The back door is locked. When there are no terminals on the map, that door opens.
{-} A hero can interact with a terminal to discard it. When he does, he may test {I} or {J} to try and claim that terminal instead.
{-} The mission will progress when the back door opens.

events.eventText: Shortly after you have opened the door, a pair of mechanical guard droids activates.
Shortly after you have opened the door, a pair of mechanical guard droids activates.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The door leads into the Imperial communications center.

{-} The door is locked. A Rebel figure can attack it (Health: 9, Defense: 2 {G}).

events.eventText: More soldiers come running, carrying a huge blaster cannon.
More soldiers come running, carrying a huge blaster cannon.

eventActions.mainText:
You start to find a way to turn the security systems against your enemies instead.

{-} You may test {I} or {J}. Enter the number of successes below.
{-} If you choose not to test, enter 0.

events.eventText:
You manage to hack into the terminal and utilize the security systems.

{-} Claim the terminal.
{-} While a hero that has claimed a terminal is attacking, apply +1 {B} to the attack results.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
One of the terminals that controls the security system.

{-} The back door is locked. When there are no terminals on the map, that door opens.
{-} A hero can interact with the terminal to discard it. When he does, he may test {I} or {J} to try and claim the terminal instead.

events.eventText:
You fail in hacking the security systems, so you just turn the teminal off.

{-} Discard the terminal.

The security systems activate. Suddenly, the terminals bristle with electric charges.

{-} When a hero interacts with a terminal, that figure suffers 1 {H} and 1 {C}.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
One of the terminals that controls the security system. It is protected by electric charges.

{-} The back door is locked. When there are no terminals on the map, that door opens.
{-} When a hero interacts with a terminal, that figure suffers 1 {H} and 1 {C}.
{-} A hero can interact with the terminal to discard it. When he does, he may test {I} or {J} to try and claim the terminal instead.

events.eventText:
The security systems activate and calibrate the Sentry Droid's target sensors.

{-} Both <color="red">Sentry Droids</color> become <color="red">Focused</color>.

The security systems activate. Suddenly, a foul-smelling repellant is sprayed into the room.

{-} {rebel} and the Rebel figure closest to {rebel} become <color="red">Weakened</color>.

With the base’ security disabled, the locked rear door slides open, revealing the intimidating form of Maul, lit only by the red glow of his ignited double lightsaber. He appears to be done running from you.

“I will die before I tell you anything, he growls at you. You raise your weapons to strike back at Maul and his team, eager to test that theory.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The back door is locked tight.

{-} When there are no terminals on the map, the door opens.

eventActions.customText: {-} If the round number is even: Attack {rebel}. Before this attack, if more than 1 Rebel is within 2 spaces and in line of sight, this figure gains Reach and Cleave 2. Otherwise, add 1 green die to the attack pool. This attack does not cost an action.

eventActions.tbText:
The Imperial forces surge forward, sweeping you with you.

{-} Push all figures on the Streets to the nearest empty space not on the Streets.
Maul's backup arrives in the form of a pair of Trandoshan mercenaries and a trained Nexu.

You raise your weapons, ready to end this now.

{-} The Rebels win when <color="red">Maul</color> and the Trandoshan Hunters are defeated.

eventActions.theText:
{-} The Rebels win when <color="red">Maul</color> and the Trandoshan Hunters are defeated.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText: Because the Trandoshan Hunters were defeated, the heroes receive 25 credits per hero.
The threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) increases by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.
